/wiki/Brickhill: Brickhill is a civil parish and electoral ward within northern Bedford in Bedfordshire, England.
/wiki/Castle,_Bedford: Castle is an electoral ward and area of Bedford, Bedfordshire, England.
/wiki/Cauldwell,_Bedfordshire: Cauldwell is an electoral ward and area within the town of Bedford, England.
/wiki/De_Parys: De Parys is an electoral ward and area within the town of Bedford, Bedfordshire, England.
/wiki/Goldington: Goldington is an electoral ward within the town of Bedford, Bedfordshire, England.  It encompasses much of the historic village and parish of Goldington that was merged with Bedford in 1934, although some parts of the old village are within the neighbouring Newnham ward.  It also includes two modern estates that are part of Renhold Parish.
/wiki/Harpur: Harpur is an electoral ward and area within the town of Bedford, England.
/wiki/Kempston_Central_and_East: Kempston Central and East is an electoral ward and area within Kempston, Bedfordshire, England.
/wiki/Kempston_North: Kempston North is an electoral ward and area within the town of Kempston, Bedfordshire, England.
/wiki/Kempston_South: Kempston South is an electoral ward and area within the town of Kempston, Bedfordshire, England.
/wiki/Kempston_West: Kempston West is an electoral ward and area within the town of Kempston, Bedfordshire, England.
/wiki/Kingsbrook: Kingsbrook is an electoral ward and area within the town of Bedford, England.
/wiki/Newnham,_Bedfordshire: Newnham is an electoral ward and area within the town of Bedford, Bedfordshire, England.
/wiki/Putnoe: Putnoe is an electoral ward on the northern side of Bedford, England.
/wiki/Queens_Park,_Bedford: Queens Park is an electoral ward and area in Bedford, England. The area's borders are approximately Bromham Road and Beverley Crescent to the north, the Midland Main Line railway line to the east, and the River Great Ouse to the south.
/wiki/Borough_of_Bedford: Bedford is a unitary authority area with borough status in the ceremonial county of Bedfordshire, England. Its council is based at Bedford, the county town of Bedfordshire. The borough contains one large urban area, the 71st largest in the United Kingdom that comprises Bedford and the adjacent town of Kempston, surrounded by a rural area with many villages. 75% of the borough's population live in the Bedford Urban Area and the five large villages which surround it, which makes up slightly less than 6% of the total land area of the Borough.
